Question: What must be displayed on the back of a trailer being towed at night?

What is the recommended distance you should allow when driving past a cyclist?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When should you use your hazard lights?

Answers.Answer: When your vehicle becomes a temporary hazard to other road users
When approaching an accident scene to warn other drivers
When reversing from a driveway and your view is not clear

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
You wish to turn left at the intersection. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Speed up and turn in front of the cyclist
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist
Stay back until the cyclist has passed the intersection
Keep driving to the next intersection

Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Passengers in your vehicle are 15 years or over. Who is responsible for making sure they wear a safety belt (seat belt)?

Answers.Answer: You as the driver of the vehicle

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. Of the 4 hazards marked, which one is most likely to require you to take urgent action?
If you are a driver involved in a crash, what is the FIRST action you should take?

Answers.Answer: Stop and place a warning triangle at the side of the road
Drive past at 20km/h until you pass the site of the crash
Stop and check to see if anyone is hurt
Tell a police officer as soon as possible

What does this road marking mean?

Answers.Answer: Vehicles displaying a mobility card may park here
You can park your wheelchair here
Wheelchair parking space for the next 30 metres

Question: For the purpose of applying the give way rule, entrance ways into public car parks should be treated as:
What should you do when you come up to a one-lane bridge?

Answers.Answer: Sound your vehicle horn and drive slowly over the bridge
Turn your vehicle headlights on and drive quickly over the bridge
Slow down and check for any oncoming vehicles before driving on
Drive on and make sure any oncoming vehicles reverse off the bridge

Question: What is the maximum legal speed limit for a car towing a trailer on the open road?
What does a blue reflector (cat’s eye) placed on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road

Question: If you are under 20, which statement is correct?

Answers.Answer: You are not permitted to drink any alcohol before driving
You may drink two standard glasses of alcohol
You may drink one standard glass of alcohol
There are no restrictions on limits of alcohol but you are not able to drive if intoxicated

Question: Before any modification is carried out on your vehicle, you should:

Answers.Answer: remove the registration plates from your vehicle
check with an authorised vehicle inspection centre
check that your warrant of fitness is current to within 1 month
record the modification on your vehicle ownership papers

Question: When you have a learner licence you do not have to have it with you when you drive if your supervisor has their licence with them.
If you have had a flat tyre and have fitted a ‘space saver wheel’ what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive directly to a place where the flat tyre can be repaired and replaced
Drive at 40km/h until the flat tyre has been repaired
Lower the pressure in the other tyres

Question: When coming up to a Stop sign, where should you stop?

Answers.Answer: With the front wheels of your vehicle on the yellow lines
With the rear wheels of your vehicle on the yellow lines
Where you can see all vehicles coming from all directions
Where you can only see vehicles coming from your right

Question: You MUST dip the headlights on your vehicle when:

Answers.Answer: changing lanes in a one way street
changing lanes to exit the motorway
